thread.title: National champion softball coach holds clinic in Gem City
thread.title_full: National champion softball coach holds clinic in Gem City

title: National champion softball coach holds clinic in Gem City
text:
National champion softball coach holds clinic in Gem City Posted: QUINCY, Ill. (WGEM) - 
During her time as a softball coach at Illinois State and Fresno State, Margie Wright won 1,386 games and a national championship in 1998. Sunday, she was at Quincy Notre Dame High School holding a clinic for local softball players hoping to improve their game."I'm trying to spread the message to make this the love of your life," said Wright. "Make softball something you love and want to do all the time. I'm trying to spread that it takes a lot of hard work." When Wright retired from coaching in 2012, she held the record for most wins by a softball coach in NCAA Division I history and still holds that title. Sunday, more than 100 softball players listened to Wright as they tried to gain any advantage they could. "She came up tome within two pitches and already found out something I was doing wrong," said Highland senior pitcher Dana Flanagan. "She's already changed me and it was awesome. I mean, she noticed something I've been doing for years that I didn't even know." For the athletes still searching for an offer and a scholarship to play at the collegiate level, Wright had a special message. "If you want to keep playing at a higher level, pretty soon you're going to find out that the commitment changes," she said. "The commitment gets much bigger. I want them to understand that." The head coach of the Lady Raiders U-14 softball team, Lori Vogel, played for Wright as a freshman at Illinois State and organized the event that brought her former coach to the Gem City."(The players) have a lot of questions, said Vogel." "What is it like to play in college? What is it like to travel and balance homework. We're also not able to help them with the skills on the field but off the field." The clinic also helped the local softball community is another way. All the money raised during the clinic will go towards the Lady Raiders U-14 softball team. ?
